Adam Visser

Passion for Programming

Growbotix
Personal
Growbotix is built on a community of Farmers. We have built a digital interface to monitor the physical world that our users have invested in so heavily.
more info
go to the page
An IoT based company that leverages open source hardware and microservices to interface with the real world. Through the digitization of the food growing process we can not only monitor and document it, but we can improve and theorize on it.

Battleship
Interview Related
Creating battleship, as a web app using Angular as the front end, and Tornado on the back end. This is currently being done as one part of a "12 Week Challenge" which I am a third of the way into.
While searching for a new job I was given the challenge to program battleship as a web app. The challenge itself asked a lot less of me than what I am doing, but I saw this as a good chance to get deeper into web sockets. This idea also fueled a challenge with myself to see if I could gain as many new skills in three months of hard work, as I could in a year of contract work at Autodesk.
Internal Team Website
Autodesk Related
After getting changed over to the cloud security team I built out a website that would help clear up confusion on cloud related issues within the companies employee base. This site also allowed for our team to reach back out to our users through blogs, news updates, and git repos.
This website acts as a base point for the cloud security team of Autodesk to get information about themselves out to fellow employees. This allows us to ensure that any team running within our cloud is using the proper amazon AMIs for our tools to scan for security reports.
Digital Key Management App
Autodesk Related
Built an app to act as an interface for an already built out code signing framework, helping to ensure security, stability, and longevity of the digital signing certificates used by Autodesk developers.
This app helps to ensure the security of digital private key files. I felshed out features to both on-board new users, watch over signing jobs being done on the remote server, and provide an approval system for access to the signing system.
Secure Development Polling Interface
Autodesk Related
As Autodesk has a large number of product managers there was a need for a centralized location to collect data on the security status of products throughout the development lifecycle.
Various questions are asked through a set of web forms to allow each type of manager to input data during product development. This information was dumped into a mysql database what was then used by Qlikview to display data.
Twelve One Five
Client - Team Member
A friend was building out a highly customized wordpress theme and needed the php code that would integrate his requirements into WordPress. This allowed him to ensure that each type of image was displayed in the right place, and in the right order.
A good friend of mine and I took on a client together as he needed somebody who would be able to program custom plugins for wordpress. As I had plenty of experience, I was able to build out the needed logic to create and manage the flow of the assets accross the site. click here to view the site
Elysium Home
Supported/Fixed Others Mistakes
Trained a fellow contractor in API integration by fixing a broken API after a host update on the website.
A friend of mine was redoing a clients website and was unable to interface with the API to pull property listings. The code itself was written in php, and was using XML to gather responses from the server. I helped to show him how integrating with APIs is done, so he culd leverage it on his own in the future. click here to view the site.
Two Americans
Client - Self Managed
As I knew a lot of Videographers I soon got in contact with an independent film maker who needed a brand refresh.
I built the site in wordpress and helped to create the brand image using Foundation. I also gave support for posting to various social media sites, and helping to improve the SEO of the site itself, as there was none before. Click here to view the site.
Blog For College
First Marketing Experience
This was my first time writing a blog which had more than my parents and friends reading. It also gave me experience in the various ways a company can market itself.
During my time in college I was a student ambassador who lead students around the building for tours. One of the job requirements was to write in a blog for future students to read. click here to view the blog.
Avnet Tech Games
Scholarships
Won numerous scholarships after competing against others in a game of networking as well as in windows OS cleaning/optimizing. Winner 2010,2011,2013
Avnet is a hardware vendor that holds competitions for skills relating to the IT industry. I competed in building an android app that would function as the only game piece needed for a game of charades. I also competed multiple times in a patch panel configuration and computer cleaning/optmizing competition.
Business Professionals of America Competition
Scholarships
This was my first time having my code reviewed by people who work with websites on a daily basis. I managed to evoke a jaw drop from the judge with my (already) in depth knowledge of javascript.
Business Professionals of America is a national company which holds competitions for high school kids to compete and get experience of taking part in the various industries we were interested in. This gave me my first chance to write code with a team, compete against others code, and have code reviewed.
Iwanttogotonotredame.com
First Client
As a young man I managed to create a site which made it on the local news, and this amount of attention soon led to our hack. This was my start as a professional, and the website was horrible.
A friend of mine had the idea to request donations in order to help pay for school. I built the website that was used to tell her story and collect these donations. I had no idea what I was doing and had to teach myself the solutions to every step of the way.
Spyro Math Tutor
First Time Teaching
My mothers best friend had a young daughter who was learning math in school, having troubles, and loved to get distracted with her Spyro Video game. I built a web app that would give her math questions and display a random quote and a random image of Spyro to keep her interested.
This was my first time that code was involved with teaching somebody else how to do something. As I was very young the app itself was not even using jQuery to get the client side logic taken care of. The server that this ran off of was in my bedroom as a kid.
Garry’s Mod Server Site
First Supported Users
I built out a website which supported a community of 5 users, allowing us to sync files needed to work on a common game server.
As a young man I played a video game with friends that required a lot of mods in order to get the most fun out of it. I built the website that we used to keep track of what mods we would want on our server. This allowed me to leverage skills in database management for the first time.
